Input data

Richard White

2018-10-12

inputdata.Rmd
library(sykdomspuls)
#> PACKAGE: sykdomspuls
#> Version
#> Developed by Richard White
#> Department of Infectious Disease Epidemiology and Modelling
#> Norwegian Institute of Public Health
#> https://folkehelseinstituttet.github.io/dashboards_sykdomspuls/

sykdomspuls requres a specific raw data format. We require one (or less) rows for each structural variable:

print(as.character(sykdomspuls::VARS$REQ_DATA_RAW_STRUCTURAL))
#> [1] "age"         "date"        "Kontakttype" "Praksis"     "municip"

For each row, the variables saved in sykdomspuls::CONFIG$SYNDROMES and sykdomspuls::VARS$REQ_DATA_RAW_OTHER contain the number of consultations that occurred for that combination of structural variables.

print(as.character(sykdomspuls::CONFIG$SYNDROMES))
#> [1] "influensa"           "gastro"              "respiratoryinternal"
#> [4] "respiratoryexternal" "lungebetennelse"     "bronkitt"
print(as.character(sykdomspuls::VARS$REQ_DATA_RAW_OTHER))
#> [1] "consult"

In total, we require the following variables:

print(as.character(sykdomspuls::VARS$REQ_DATA_RAW_ALL))
#>  [1] "age"                 "date"                "Kontakttype"        
#>  [4] "Praksis"             "municip"             "influensa"          
#>  [7] "gastro"              "respiratoryinternal" "respiratoryexternal"
#> [10] "lungebetennelse"     "bronkitt"            "consult"

We can use the function GenFakeDataRaw() to generate a set of fake data for municip5054.

d <- GenFakeDataRaw()
print(d)
#>            age       date    Kontakttype  Praksis     municip influensa
#>      1: Totalt 2006-01-01 Telefonkontakt Fastlege municip1624         7
#>      2: Totalt 2006-01-02 Telefonkontakt Fastlege municip1624         3
#>      3: Totalt 2006-01-03 Telefonkontakt Fastlege municip1624         4
#>      4: Totalt 2006-01-04 Telefonkontakt Fastlege municip1624         4
#>      5: Totalt 2006-01-05 Telefonkontakt Fastlege municip1624         6
#>     ---                                                                
#> 255664:    65+ 2018-12-27    Legekontakt Legevakt municip5054         7
#> 255665:    65+ 2018-12-28    Legekontakt Legevakt municip5054         3
#> 255666:    65+ 2018-12-29    Legekontakt Legevakt municip5054         4
#> 255667:    65+ 2018-12-30    Legekontakt Legevakt municip5054         6
#> 255668:    65+ 2018-12-31    Legekontakt Legevakt municip5054         8
#>         gastro respiratoryinternal respiratoryexternal lungebetennelse
#>      1:      5                   3                   6               5
#>      2:      8                   7                   4               1
#>      3:      3                   9                   5               4
#>      4:      4                  11                   7               6
#>      5:      4                   1                   6               4
#>     ---                                                               
#> 255664:      2                   4                   5               7
#> 255665:      2                   1                   4               6
#> 255666:      4                   6                   5               7
#> 255667:      9                   3                   4               3
#> 255668:      1                   4                   6               5
#>         bronkitt consult
#>      1:       10      87
#>      2:        3      64
#>      3:        5      81
#>      4:        4      90
#>      5:        3      68
#>     ---                 
#> 255664:        5      77
#> 255665:        3      76
#> 255666:        4      78
#> 255667:        1      77
#> 255668:        2      74

And we can then use the function ValidateDataRaw() to ensure that our fake data is in the correct format:

print(ValidateDataRaw(d))
#> [1] TRUE

Developed by Richard White.
